result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon Robert Goetz

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Dillon Robert Goetz in court.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Dillon Robert Goetz.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel J. Gabler in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Laatsch states the defendant has been in treatment and has delayed obtaining license.
Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 09:45 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Dillon Robert Goetz in court.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Dillon Robert Goetz.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22CM286; 22TR769; 22TR770; 22JC22A)   Atty. Laatsch states is just meeting defendant for first time today.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.
(Copy mailed to Def and Def Atty)

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dillon Robert Goetz in court. (22CM286; 22TR769; 22TR770; 22JC22A)  Defendant states just completed treatment last week and has a vehicle and needs to install IID and take assessment  Defendant states is not eligible for State Public Defender.  Court appoints Atty Daryl Laatsch.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10-1-2022.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dillon Robert Goetz in court.  (22CM286, 22CM298; 22TR769; 22TR770; 22JC22A)  Defendant has 2 more weeks of treatment and then will install IID, have an assessment and reinstate to obtain license.  State advises there was not a pretrial. Defendant unsure if eligible for SPD.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dillon Robert Goetz in court. (22CM286; 22TR769; 22TR770; Waukesha Co. 22CT127)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond.   Defendant states needs to install IID and financially difficult.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
